stream_context.summary: Kaze prototyped the scrolling shooter level inspired by Super Mario Land, modelling a bird enemy, picking sound effects, testing collision and camera behaviour, and discussing technical limits and distribution hurdles.

development_findings.summary: Built a low-poly 3D model for the Mario Land bird enemy; final version uses 50 triangles, outline added for visibility.
Enemy death will be an 8-frame animated texture rather than a mesh swap to save memory.
development_findings.quote: What if we just have it be an animated texture… it’s that simple.

development_findings.summary: Camera must stay fixed behind Mario; attempts to offset or follow him caused aiming issues and excessive movement.
development_findings.quote: I tried having the camera follow Mario… it was way too much movement.

development_findings.summary: Fixed a bug where Mario was rendered off-centre in the shooter view.
development_findings.quote: What the fuck, you’re right… How is he not centered? There we go.

development_findings.summary: Stage already at ~19 000 triangles; additional models must stay small; memory budget is tight.
development_findings.quote: This already has 19 000 triangles and it’s barely finished.

development_findings.summary: Birds made ‘shootable’ by iterating through all cannon shots each frame; cannonball impact effect added after chat feedback.
Selected Bullet Bill launch SFX (Mario Land cannon) after testing several existing samples.
Will choose microcode (RSP vs RDP) per level to maximise FPS; switching mid-frame is technically possible but unsafe.
GLideN’s point-filter bug makes symmetrical sprites appear skewed; hopes RT64 or a GlideN update lands before release.
Plans to finish two more stages; Course 14 is already "half-way done", demo with first course coming "in the near future".

context_findings.summary: Kaze was visibly fatigued; parents are visiting and prolonged social contact drains him.
context_findings.quote: Even though that looked so easy just now, I don’t know why I’m so exhausted… my parents are here right now, I can’t be around people for too long.

context_findings.summary: Philosophy: lower barrier to entry—hack must run without end-users compiling plugins or tweaking emulator settings.
context_findings.quote: Every step along the way you lose some percentage of your player base; I don’t want people to have to compile a plugin to play my game.

context_findings.summary: Accepts risk of Nintendo takedown but continues regardless; last contact was in 2019.
context_findings.quote: Yes of course there is a worry that Nintendo is just going to say now fuck you… you just have to live with that.

context_findings.summary: Wants consistent thumbnail style on YouTube for algorithm visibility.
context_findings.quote: It’s important on YouTube that your thumbnails have a somewhat consistent style, because it makes people more likely to click them.

biobak.summary: Joined late during low-energy portion; no specific task discussed this stream.

zeina.summary: Mentioned in chat contextually (needs a separate Minecraft account, is "very very cold"). No project work this session.

key_stories.title: Off-centre Mario Bug
key_stories.summary: While demonstrating the shooter view, chat noticed Mario wasn’t centred. After quick debugging Kaze realigned the camera.
key_stories.challenge: Player sprite appeared slightly to the left, harming aim.
key_stories.process: Checked camera coordinates, discovered misalignment, updated transform.
key_stories.outcome: Camera now perfectly centred; formed basis for future aiming logic.
key_stories.key_quote: Wow, what the fuck? How is he not centered?

key_stories.title: Choosing Animated Texture over Extra Meshes
key_stories.summary: Enemy death animation initially considered as separate 3D models. Memory limits forced a rethink.
key_stories.challenge: Storing multiple meshes would exceed triangle and memory budgets.
key_stories.process: Analysed sprite sheet from Mario Land; realised an 8-frame texture swap could replicate effect.
key_stories.outcome: Adopted animated texture approach, saving space and code complexity.
key_stories.key_quote: We’re actually not doing voxel art here; we just make this texture spawn.

key_stories.title: Reducing Player Setup Friction
key_stories.summary: Kaze explained why the hack must bundle a ready-to-run emulator/plugin.
key_stories.challenge: Custom plugins like RT64 currently require manual compilation and configuration.
key_stories.process: Outlined plan to distribute pre-configured emulator once stable plugins exist.
key_stories.outcome: Design principle for final release: one-click launch to maximise audience.
key_stories.key_quote: The less people have to set up, the better; ROM hackers severely underrate the barrier to entry.
